instructions.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
instructions.data: Replace old and dilapidated wood. Scrape off all loose, scaling, flaking, and peeling paint manually or by using BOYSEN®® Paint and Varnish Remover B‑141, as necessary. Wash surfaces clean and completely remove chemical residue. Let it dry. In case of mildew infestation, treat with a bleach solution (1:3, laundry bleach to water, respectively) by swabbing or brushing. To ensure proper treatment, let stand for 24 hours before cleaning off residue. Let dry. Surface to be repainted should be clean and dry, free from oil, grease, dust and dirt, and all possible contaminants.

instructions.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
instructions.data: Primer (for resulting bare substrate): BOYSEN®® Flatwall Enamel B‑800 Putty: BOYSEN®® Plasolux Glazing Putty B‑311 Topcoat (2 coats): BOYSEN®® Quick Drying Enamel

instructions.title: NOTES
instructions.data: Check paint compatibility of BOYSEN®® Acrytex™ to the existing coating. Use only BOYSEN®® Paint Thinner B‑0340 as thinning solvent.

calculator.title: Putty (Spot)
calculator.item: BOYSEN®® Plasolux Glazing Putty B‑311

calculator.title: Topcoat
calculator.note: For semi-gloss alkyd type topcoat, use BOYSEN®® Semi-Gloss Enamel B‑200
